text: I feel like I'm eating because of real hunger or because of emotional hunger wearing a disguise.
I eat when I'm stressed, anxious, sad, or experiencing other strong emotions.
I have difficulty distinguishing between physical hunger and emotional hunger.
I use food to comfort myself or to cope with difficult feelings.
I eat even when I'm not physically hungry, just because food is available or I'm bored.
I feel guilty, ashamed, or anxious after eating, especially after emotional eating episodes.
I eat in secret or hide my eating behaviors from others.
I feel like I have no control over my eating, especially when I'm emotional.
I eat large amounts of food quickly, especially when I'm feeling emotional.
I feel like food is my primary way of dealing with stress or negative emotions.
I can recognize when I'm physically hungry versus emotionally hungry.
I have a healthy relationship with food and don't use it to cope with emotions.
I can stop eating when I'm full and don't continue eating for emotional reasons.
I have healthy coping strategies for dealing with stress and emotions that don't involve food.
I can enjoy food without feeling guilty or anxious about my eating choices.
I feel like I'm constantly thinking about food or my next meal, especially when stressed.
I eat to fill an emotional void or to avoid dealing with difficult feelings.
I feel like my eating behaviors are out of control and I can't stop even when I want to.
I use food as a reward or to celebrate, but also to comfort myself when I'm feeling down.
I can maintain a balanced approach to eating that isn't driven primarily by emotions.
